concept.title: Introduction to the Blockquote Element
concept.shortdesc: Blockquote is a block-level text styling element for writing in HTML.

conbody.p: Blockquote is an element used to denote when a segment of text is a block quotation. In conventional writing, blockquotes are longer excerpts or quotes (usually more than 50 words) of text cited from outside sources of text.

Using a blockquote can be beneficial to one's own writing. A quotation can be used as the basis for a writing argument or analysis. When cited properly, blockquotes are seen as credible pieces of evidence.
Blockquotes can be a visual element as well. With the use of Cascading Style Sheets or CSS, the appearance of blockquotes can be modified from its default look as an indentation in the text
